necessity of coming to terms w disagreement (https://t.co/XXk7O581eE) applies not only btw groups, but also within groups‚Äîour own & others‚Äô

Many westerners, if they acknowledge this at all, barely pay lip-service to it.

It is *immensely patronizing*.
Muslims‚Äî& their cultures, communities, perspectives, etc.‚Äîare every bit as complex, multifaceted, & fraught as non-Muslims‚Äô.

I find #ExMuslimBecause valuable as it foregrounds something often forgotten or elided (& thus discomfiting):
‚ÄòMuslims‚Äô are not a monolith.
* NB: Exceptions may apply‚Äîas in certain scientific endeavours; the phenomenon in question, however, is socio-cultural in nature.

An individual‚Äôs endorsement of proposition P does not necessarily undermine proposition Q.

Overwhelmingly, reality is plurality.
Articulation of alternative perspectives does not ‚Äòcause‚Äô violence‚Äîregardless of what the violent claim.

Of late, so many have grown afraid of dissenting speech. This is immensely tragic.
Disagreement is not hate.
